reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights while I did some tourism in the area. Being adjacent to the Nagano Station, the location was perfect for this. There are plenty of restaurants around. The temple is a 25-30 minute walk. Convenience stores, banks, and other amenities are very closeby.
reviews.title: Great value, great location

reviews.text: The hotel itself was clean and well maintained. Excellent value. rooms are small, but I came here to sleep, not sit around the room. The internet access was free, although I had a lot of issues with it. I think the pipe is pretty narrow, so doing anything other than viewing a simple, static webpage is too much for it.
reviews.title: Well Managed, Roomy, Excellent Location

reviews.text: The front desk speaks a little English if you are patient. Certainly better than my non-existant Japanese!
reviews.title: Beats all on location

reviews.text: Only complaint: despite putting the 'Do not disturb' indicator on, the cleaning staff came into my room and serviced it, leaving a slip of paper saying that it was 'required' due to security and safety reasons. I find this practice very annoying and urge the management to reconsider.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay in Nagano

reviews.text: Rooms were clean and nice, and although the hotel is big and a bit unpersonal, it's excellent value, and has a good location as well. Lots of places to eat around the area and excellent cakes available at the hotel's lobby cafe as well. Not for romantic honeymoon getaways perhaps, but for simple, uncomplicated stay in Nagano, look no further.
reviews.title: Good price and central location

reviews.text: If you're burned out on staying at ryokan and minshuku, the Metropolitan is a nice corrective. Located steps from the JR station, it's a huge, well-run place with clean, airy rooms (all with LAN and private bath), a bar at the top and a good cafe at the base.
reviews.title: Good Western-style hotel

reviews.text: I booked two double rooms through hotels.com and I found it a very good value. This is a JR hotel, and it was considerably better that other similarly priced hotel in our trip. Being next to the JR station and a bus terminal was a plus. You can even walk to Zenko-ji, Nagano main attraction. Rooms were spacious for Japanese standards; Staff was very helpful and spoke good English.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — None that I can think of

reviews.text: We had just arrived for a ski vacation in Shiga Kogen. After getting off of the bullet train late at night with skis and luggage in tow, this hotel was just across the parking lot from the train station. The hotel was perfectly adequate for our needs (easy in and out, no smoking rooms, english speaking receptionists, 24 hour desk for early and late transit on the train). We were walking distance to coffee shops, atm at 7 eleven (accepts american debit cards), shopping centers, and convenience stores.
reviews.title: Perfect for travelers just off the train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is literally 1 min from the Nagano train station and there is a sign from the station exit that reads "Metropolitan Nagano Hotel" - impossible to get lost finding it, even with jetlag!
reviews.title: Convenient, good value business hotel

reviews.text: We booked online from their official website, selecting the "Web reservation happy day" deal which is for room only; and found the prices very reasonable (much cheaper than their official rate, discounted rate for JR Pass holders, or even from other online sites).
reviews.title: Railway station hotel

reviews.text: I should also note, one definite plus for booking on their website is that they do not ask for a deposit, and there is no cancellation fees. We had to change our schedule in the last minute (literally, the night before our arrival) and found this flexibility invaluable.
reviews.title: Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is very grand and the reception was friendly, professional, and spoke good English. The room itself I would rate above average, on account of the excellent room rate. We only ended up staying one night, and booked a "double economy", so the room was quite small, but sufficient for our purposes.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location

reviews.text: What can I say, everything was great: location directly at the station, nice big entrance hall, elegant atmosphere, a room larger than usual in Japan and with a nice view, a bathroom with a "real" tub and great service. I booked through the internet and got a great deal, so it was really value for money!
reviews.title: Almost perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised at how nice the rooms were. Completely convenient to the train station, too. The beds were very comfortable with two pillows each of different firmness
reviews.title: This hotel was excellent

reviews.text: We had planned to stay at a tiny apartment belonging to our former au pair and her husband, but we decided at the last minute that everyone might be more comfortable if we just got a hotel near Nagano station. As soon as we walked out of the station, we could see the high-rise hotel to the left across the parking area. We appreciated that immediate visibility a lot. The area around the station has a number of shops and places to eat. We were happy to get to the hotel and turn on the air conditioning to chill for a few minutes before meeting our group for "izakaya" dinner. Our room faced the rail tracks but I did not notice any noise. The room was spacious and the bathroom was nice. I wish that we had stayed longer in Nagano because the area was so interesting and the summer weather is cooler than it is in many areas during July.
reviews.title: Convenient location within a short walk of Nagano Rail Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know if it was just my room, but the carpet was really disgusting. It was really sticky and slightly moist. The carpet and decor was from the 70s and I had a problem with touching anything in the room. I don't think it was very clean.
reviews.title: I recommend going to Nagano, but there must be a better hotel there than the Metropolitan

reviews.text: Everything else was fine, the customer service was good, the view was nice, the hotel was very conveniently located by the train station. Walking from the hotel to the temple got you through the entire town which was a nice walk and I wouldn't have done otherwise. It isn't too far from anything and I wasn't bothered by any train noise. There is a really lovely soba dumpling shop between the hotel and the station. I recommend getting a couple before you board. delicious!
reviews.title: very nice hotel

likes.liked: — close to station and my son
